item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, September 19, 2024 at 9:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Have you ever seen soldering this close? [video] (440 points | 75 comments)
2. Why wordfreq will not be updated (1533 points | 458 comments)
3. Is Tor still safe to use? (542 points | 358 comments)
4. Comic Mono (324 points | 92 comments)
5. Nintendo Files Suit for Infringement of Patent Rights Against Pocketpair, Inc (244 points | 185 comments)
6. Llama 3.1 Omni Model (255 points | 28 comments)

8. Aliens and the Enlightenment (14 points | discuss)
9. Ruby-SAML pwned by XML signature wrapping attacks (103 points | 53 comments)
10. Moshi: A speech-text foundation model for real time dialogue (250 points | 45 comments)
11. GM electric vehicles can now access Tesla Superchargers (158 points | 167 comments)
12. Show HN: ts-remove-unused – Remove unused code from your TypeScript project (28 points | 14 comments)
13. J2ME-Loader: J2ME emulator for Android devices (53 points | 10 comments)
14. Debugging Behind the Iron Curtain (2010) (54 points | 13 comments)
15. 0day Contest for End-of-Life Devices Announced (244 points | 135 comments)
16. Interning in Go (114 points | 30 comments)

18. Bento: Jupyter Notebooks at Meta (200 points | 96 comments)
19. Geometric Search Trees (35 points | 5 comments)
20. Apple mobile processors are now made in America by TSMC (1547 points | 788 comments)
21. OpenTelemetry and vendor neutrality: how to build an observability strategy (91 points | 17 comments)
22. A overview of binaries, ELF, and NoMMU on Linux (105 points | 3 comments)
23. iOS 18 breaks IMAPS self-signed certs (95 points | 104 comments)
24. LinkedIn is now using everyone's content to train their AI tool (334 points | 159 comments)
25. Ask HN: My son might be blind – how to best support (123 points | 42 comments)
26. Text makeup – a tool to decode and explore Unicode strings (67 points | 6 comments)
27. Qwen2.5: A Party of Foundation Models (148 points | 29 comments)
28. Show HN: I made crowdwave – imagine Twitter/Reddit but every post is a voicemail (129 points | 89 comments)
29. The Dune Shell (203 points | 63 comments)
30. Meticulous (YC S21) is hiring to eliminate UI tests ( | hide)
